Remarks . In the Gulf of California
E. maculata
has been reported between 29°02’N , 112°47’W and 23°15’N , 108°22’W as a common species ( Siegel-Causey 1982 ). Our material was recorded from the central (northernmost record at 27°53’09”N ) and southern Gulf, south to 22°21’39”N ( Fig. 1 ). Its occurrence off Jalisco and Colima was observed when “El Niño” conditions were present in the area (
Gasca et al . 2012
), thus suggesting that it might be associated to warmer water than its congener
E. minuta
, at least in this region. Adult
E. maculata
reach a total length of 8‒12 mm . This species can be distinguished from
E minuta
by its possession of a pereopod I fourth segment narrower than the fifth, the carpal process of pereopod II not being massive, but tapering to a distal point, and the telson tip with slightly concave sides.
